title: Chapter II - UNIFORM RULES FOR THE NEW YORK STATE TRIAL COURTS
content:
Chapter II - UNIFORM RULES FOR THE NEW YORK STATE TRIAL COURTS
State Regulations

Part 200 - Uniform Rules For Courts Exercising Criminal Jurisdiction

Part 202 - Uniform Civil Rules for the Supreme Court and the County Court (§ 202.1 to 202.72)

Part 205 - Uniform Rules For The Family Court (§ 205.1 to 205.86)

Part 206 - Uniform Rules For The Court Of Claims (§ 206.1 to 206.25)

Part 207 - Uniform Rules For The Surrogate's Court (§ 207.1 to 207.64)

Part 208 - UNIFORM CIVIL RULES FOR THE NEW YORK CITY CIVIL COURT (§ 208.1 to 208.43)

Part 210 - Uniform Civil Rules for the City Courts outside the City of New York (§ 210.1 to 210.415)

Part 212 - Uniform Civil Rules for the District Courts (§ 212.1 to 212.415)

Part 214 - Uniform Civil Rules for the Justice Courts (§ 214.1 to 214.13)

Part 215 - Use Of Recycled Paper (§ 215.1 to 215.3)

Part 216 - Sealing Of Court Records In Civil Actions In The Trial Courts (§ 216.1)

Part 217 - Access To Court Interpreter Services For Persons With Limited English Proficiency (§ 217.1 to 217.2)

Part 218 - Uniform Rules For The Trial Courts In Capital Cases (§ 218.0 to 218.30 to 218.32)

Part 220 - Uniform Rules For Jury Selection And Deliberation (Subpart A to B)

Part 221 - Uniform Rules For The Conduct Of Depositions (§ 221.1 to 221.3)

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. Part 200 - Uniform Rules For Courts Exercising Criminal Jurisdiction

Part 202 - Uniform Civil Rules for the Supreme Court and the County Court (§ 202.1 to 202.72)
